Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of antibiotic-impregnated shunt catheters (AISC) in reducing the incidence of bacterial shunt infection in patients with hydrocephalus.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of bacterial infections, whereas the rate of shunt failure was our secondary endpoint.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 27 articles with 27 266 shunt operations were included in this study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The results indicated that using AISC is significantly associated with reduction in infections (OR = 0.42; 95% CI: 0.33-0.54).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The protocol was registered on PROSPERO.
